intro: Drosanthe hyssopifolia, commonly known as the hyssop-leaved drosanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Drosanthe hyssopifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand coastal conditions.
